policy_draft.objectives: The primary objective of this procurement policy is to ensure the acquisition of goods and services in a manner that is efficient, transparent, and compliant with all applicable regulations. The policy aims to achieve value for money, promote fair competition, and mitigate risks associated with procurement activities.
policy_draft.scope: This policy applies to all procurement activities undertaken by the organization, including the acquisition of goods, services, and works. It covers all departments and units within the organization and applies to all employees involved in the procurement process.
policy_draft.procurement_methods: The organization will utilize a variety of procurement methods including open tendering, restricted tendering, request for quotations, and direct procurement. The choice of method will depend on the nature and value of the goods or services being procured, as well as any specific regulatory requirements.
policy_draft.evaluation_criteria: Bids will be evaluated based on a set of criteria including price, quality, delivery time, and compliance with specifications. Additional criteria may include the bidder's past performance, financial stability, and capacity to deliver. The evaluation process will be conducted by a committee to ensure fairness and transparency.
policy_draft.compliance_measures: To ensure compliance with this policy and relevant regulations, regular audits will be conducted. All procurement activities must be documented and records maintained for a minimum of five years. Any deviations from the policy must be reported and justified in writing.

procedure_development.step_1: Solicitation of bids: The procurement team will prepare and issue a request for proposals (RFP) or invitation to bid (ITB) to potential suppliers. The solicitation documents will include detailed specifications, terms and conditions, and submission deadlines.
procedure_development.step_2: Evaluation of received bids: Upon receipt of bids, the procurement committee will review and evaluate each submission against the established criteria. This process will involve scoring each bid and shortlisting the most suitable candidates.
procedure_development.step_3: Negotiation with bidders: The procurement team will engage in negotiations with shortlisted bidders to clarify terms, negotiate prices, and ensure that all requirements are met. This step aims to achieve the best possible terms for the organization.
procedure_development.step_4: Awarding of contracts: Following successful negotiations, the contract will be awarded to the bidder that offers the best value for money. A formal contract will be drafted and signed by both parties, outlining all agreed terms and conditions.
procedure_development.step_5: Post-award management: The procurement team will monitor the performance of the supplier to ensure compliance with the contract terms. This includes regular progress reviews, quality checks, and addressing any issues that arise during the contract period.
